consultation regarding all things trees. We are here to provide our wealth of knowledge experience and education to you in identifying, helping and providing you with quick reliable and precise outcomes for your tree needs. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes regarding pest, disease or root mapping and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out more?</p><h5>ï¿½</h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:5;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:7;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:8;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:11:\"The process\";s:4:\"text\";s:1165:\"<ol><li>You call us; let us know what you want and how much you are willing to spend?</li><li>We will arrange an onsite visit, to discuss and come up with a design and rough sketch with your ideas and imagination to guide us! AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industryï¿½1998.</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:5:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:1;s:5:\"style\";a:2:{s:27:\"background_image_attachment\";b:0;s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:2;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:13:\"Why Choose Us\";s:4:\"text\";s:1633:\"<h5><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\"> [fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½<b>CONSULTATION &amp; SOLUTIONS</b></h5><p>At Canopy Tree we believe there is a need for consultation regarding all things trees. We are here to provide our wealth of knowledge experience and education to you in identifying, helping and providing you with quick reliable and precise outcomes for your tree needs. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes regarding pest, disease or root mapping and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out more?</p><h5>ï¿½</h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:2;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:3;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:13:\"Tree AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.</p><h5>ï¿½</h5><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-tree\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5><p>Canopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industryï¿½1998.</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:1;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:2;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:13:\"Why Choose Us\";s:4:\"text\";s:1633:\"<h5><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\"> [fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½<b>CONSULTATION &amp; SOLUTIONS</b></h5><p>At Canopy Tree we believe there is a need for consultation regarding all things trees. We are here to provide our wealth of knowledge experience and education to you in identifying, helping and providing you with quick reliable and precise outcomes for your tree needs. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes regarding pest, disease or root mapping and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out more?</p><h5>ï¿½</h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:2;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:3;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:16:\"Feature AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.</p><h5>ï¿½</h5><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">[fa icon=\"fa-tree\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5><p>Canopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industryï¿½1998.</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:1;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:2;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:13:\"Why Choose Us\";s:4:\"text\";s:1633:\"<h5><span style=\"color: #16d116;\"> [fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½<b>CONSULTATION &amp; SOLUTIONS</b></h5><p>At Canopy Tree we believe there is a need for consultation regarding all things trees. We are here to provide our wealth of knowledge experience and education to you in identifying, helping and providing you with quick reliable and precise outcomes for your tree needs. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes regarding pest, disease or root mapping and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out more?</p><h5>ï¿½</h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:2;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:3;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:16:\"Feature Services\";s:4:\"text\";s:0:\"\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:2;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:3;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:4;a:3:{s:7:\"page_id\";i:693;s:6:\"layout\";s:5:\"block\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:16:\"PT_Featured_Page\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:3;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:4;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:5;a:3:{s:7:\"page_id\";i:697;s:6:\"layout\";s:5:\"block\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:16:\"PT_Featured_Page\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:3;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:5;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:6;a:3:{s:7:\"page_id\";i:715;s:6:\"layout\";s:5:\"block\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:16:\"PT_Featured_Page\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:3;s:4:\"cell\";i:2;s:2:\"id\";i:6;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:7;a:5:{s:5:\"title\";s:12:\"Testimonials\";s:9:\"autocycle\";s:2:\"no\";s:8:\"interval\";i:5000;s:12:\"testimonials\";a:1:{i:2;a:4:{s:5:\"quote\";s:580:\"Canopy Tree did a large amount of work at our property during 2008, trimming a large Tree in our back yard that hung heavily over the neighbours fence and our own roof. We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes regarding pest, disease or root mapping and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. The business is locally owned and operated, which enables us to offer high quality Tree work, tree care &amp; consultancy with practical and safe outcomes. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.</p><h5>ï¿½</h5><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-tree\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5><p>Canopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industryï¿½1998.</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:1;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:2;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:13:\"Why Choose Us\";s:4:\"text\";s:1633:\"<h5><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\"> [fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½<b>CONSULTATION &amp; SOLUTIONS</b></h5><p>At Canopy Tree we believe there is a need for consultation regarding all things trees. We are here to provide our wealth of knowledge experience and education to you in identifying, helping and providing you with quick reliable and precise outcomes for your tree needs. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes regarding pest, disease or root mapping and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Call us today with your enquiry?</p><h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\"><span style=\"color: #ffffff;\">[fa icon=\"fa-TREE\"]</span>ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5><p>Report &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist, is qualified to write reports and management plans for councils, commercial or private clients. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the required education and experience in the tree industry. At Canopy Tree PL we can facilitate with providing an AQF level 5 Consulting Arborist for your next tree report or building project. Please call us today to find out more?</p><h5>ï¿½</h5>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:1;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:2;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:3;a:5:{s:4:\"type\";s:6:\"visual\";s:5:\"title\";s:16:\"Feature Services\";s:4:\"text\";s:0:\"\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:2;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:3;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:4;a:3:{s:7:\"page_id\";i:693;s:6:\"layout\";s:5:\"block\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:16:\"PT_Featured_Page\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:3;s:4:\"cell\";i:0;s:2:\"id\";i:4;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:5;a:3:{s:7:\"page_id\";i:697;s:6:\"layout\";s:5:\"block\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:16:\"PT_Featured_Page\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:3;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:5;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:6;a:3:{s:7:\"page_id\";i:715;s:6:\"layout\";s:5:\"block\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:16:\"PT_Featured_Page\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:3;s:4:\"cell\";i:2;s:2:\"id\";i:6;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}i:7;a:5:{s:5:\"title\";s:12:\"Testimonials\";s:9:\"autocycle\";s:2:\"no\";s:8:\"interval\";i:5000;s:12:\"testimonials\";a:1:{i:2;a:4:{s:5:\"quote\";s:580:\"Canopy Tree did a large amount of work at our property during 2008, trimming a large Tree in our back yard that hung heavily over the neighbours fence and our own roof. Experience has taught us that certain trees react in different ways to pruning and at different times of year. There is debate at which time may be the best but it is generally thought with deciduous trees may be after the first flush of growth or late season growth. Pruning in winter just after the coldest months will provide profuse growth when the tree comes back into leaf. Autumn may be the least desirable time.</p><p>Australian Natives and evergreens should be pruned after extension growth has finished in the summer months and as a general rule not too heavy. Pruning some natives in the winter months can take them longer to seal and repair the cut. As a rule I have noticed it is better to make lots of small cuts than remove large limbs.</p><p><strong>Methods;</strong>ï¿½used to carry out work, are climbing methods, EWP, ladders and step ladders. Extendable poles with attachments (saw or mechanical pruners), motorised pole saw, hand saws and secateurs.</p><p><strong>Reasons;ï¿½</strong>for shaping and pruning could be to encourage better form &amp; structure in early stages of growth, light penetration for fruiting, encouraging to grow in certain ways, pruning to avoid conflict with service lines or building lines or to limit pest and disease.ï¿½</p><p>When thinning the crown of a tree we are sensitive to the species as each tree will react in different way according to how and when it is pruned. There is and art to performing this type of work that only a trained and experienced person will know. At Canopy Tree PL we not only know the wright methods for thinning but have a vast knowledge and experience spanning over two decades.</p><p>Shaping of Small Trees is carried out on young newly planted trees, small ornamental trees, small street trees, trees under service lines or power lines. These are some of the many pruning tasks we are asked to carry out at Canopy Tree for our clients.</p><p>Removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown.</p><p>Crown Lifting is done by cutting the lower branches of a tree, increasing the distance between ground level and the first branch.</p><p>ï¿½</p>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:5:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:4:\"grid\";i:0;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:1;s:5:\"style\";a:2:{s:27:\"background_image_attachment\";b:0;s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}}s:5:\"grids\";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:\"cells\";i:2;s:5:\"style\";a:0:{}}}s:10:\"grid_cells\";a:2:{i:0;a:2:{s:4:\"grid\";i:0;s:6:\"weight\";d:0.381966007907942717292115730742807500064373016357421875;}i:1;a:2:{s:4:\"grid\";i:0;s:6:\"weight\";d:0.61803399209205733821903550051501952111721038818359375;}}}" WHERE meta_id = "12762"

At Canopy Tree we do remove trees if it is justified and the permission is granted from your local council. Having over two decades of experience we can say that all trees are a challenge and no one tree is the same but you can be confident we will be safe professional and only leave you a memory when it is gone. We remove both small and large trees, dead and dangerous ones too. Please call us today for a free estimate on your tree?</p><p><strong>Methods;</strong>ï¿½that can be used to remove a tree depend on the site, size and condition of the tree and skill of the team. Climbing and rigging methods recognised in arboriculture in conjunction with a lowering device (friction drum) are the most common ways that trees are removed.</p><p>EWPS and cranes can be used if there is appropriate access and room to set up. Cranes are used to lift up tree parts or whole tree and lowered down into an appropriate place for processing. The mechanical advantage that a crane provides can speed up the job and provide a safer working environment for the crew.ï¿½Tree Removal Sydney.</p><p><strong>Reasons;</strong>ï¿½for removing a tree could be but not limited to; that it has outgrown its position, causing damage, presenting a hazard and risk of failure, unstable, dead tree, new development, affected by pest and disease or poisonous.</p><p><strong>Stump Removal:</strong> The process where by a stump is removed to below ground level or completely removed from the ground. Canopy Tree has the ability to remove stumps of all sizes in all access situations. Give us a call today for a free estimate over the phone or via email, with no obligation. Extendable poles with attachments (saw or mechanical pruners), motorised pole saw, hand saws and secateurs.</p><p><strong>Reasons;ï¿½</strong>for shaping and pruning could be to encourage better form &amp; structure in early stages of growth, light penetration for fruiting, encouraging to grow in certain ways, pruning to avoid conflict with service lines or building lines or to limit pest and disease.ï¿½</p><p>When thinning the crown of a tree we are sensitive to the species as each tree will react in different way according to how and when it is pruned. There is and art to performing this type of work that only a trained and experienced person will know. At Canopy Tree PL we not only know the wright methods for thinning but have a vast knowledge and experience spanning over two decades.</p><p>Shaping of Small Trees is carried out on young newly planted trees, small ornamental trees, small street trees, trees under service lines or power lines. These are some of the many pruning tasks we are asked to carry out at Canopy Tree for our clients.</p><p>Removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown.</p><p>Crown Lifting is done by cutting the lower branches of a tree, increasing the distance between ground level and the first branch.</p><p>ï¿½</p>\";s:6:\"filter\";s:1:\"1\";s:11:\"panels_info\";a:6:{s:5:\"class\";s:30:\"WP_Widget_Black_Studio_TinyMCE\";s:3:\"raw\";b:0;s:4:\"grid\";i:0;s:4:\"cell\";i:1;s:2:\"id\";i:1;s:5:\"style\";a:1:{s:18:\"background_display\";s:4:\"tile\";}}}}s:5:\"grids\";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:\"cells\";i:2;s:5:\"style\";a:0:{}}}s:10:\"grid_cells\";a:2:{i:0;a:2:{s:4:\"grid\";i:0;s:6:\"weight\";d:0.381966007908000004800186388820293359458446502685546875;}i:1;a:2:{s:4:\"grid\";i:0;s:6:\"weight\";d:0.61803399209200005071096484243753366172313690185546875;}}}" WHERE meta_id = "12831"

Climbing and rigging methods recognised in arboriculture in conjunction with a lowering device (friction drum) are the most common ways that trees are removed.</p><p>EWPS and cranes can be used if there is appropriate access and room to set up. Cranes are used to lift up tree parts or whole tree and lowered down into an appropriate place for processing. Trees will show many different signs indicating good vigour as they grow and mature, they are self-optimising structures that will change over many years of growth to maturity and in some cases not only over years but decades and centuries. To the trained eye these will be more obvious and at Canopy Tree we are continually learning tree signs that indicate vigour, growth, stress and structural change. If you have concerns about your tree asset and its condition, please call us today for a consultation. Canopy Tree has the ability to remove stumps of all sizes in all access situations. Give us a call today for a free estimate over the phone or via email, with no obligation. A description of site access and pictures of access and stump when sending an email will be required so we can give you estimate over the phone?</p><p><strong>Methods;</strong> used to remove stumps can range from digging out a small stump with a mattock and spade, grinding with a stump grinding machine to using excavators to dig out large stumps. Mostly in gardens one would use a stump grinder as it provides a mechanical advantage, which is quick and less demanding on the operator. There are different size stump grinders that will suit different size stumps and access to the stump.</p><div>Stumps are hard to remove by hand an often need to be ground out with a stump grinding machine. The machine has a circular blade with tungsten tip cutting teeth that slews side to side taking small bits out of the stump with every pass.ï¿½All types and size tree stumps (up to 10m diameter),can be removed, including stumps in areas difficult to access.ï¿½On most occasions, the stump is ground out completely up to 2ft deep allowing replanting afterwards. We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5>\r\nReport &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome that is required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry.\r\n<h5></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Who We Are?</h3>\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>CANOPY TREE PTY LTD</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree PL has been servicing the greater Sydney and Macarthur areas for 16 years. The business is locally owned and operated, which enables us to offer high quality Tree work, tree care &amp; consultancy with practical and safe outcomes. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry. [button style=\"primary\" href=\"tel:1300 799 540\"]CALL NOW[/button] [button style=\"default\" href=\"contact-us\"]INQUIRE NOW[/button] ï¿½ <a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/9-360x240.png\" alt=\"9\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Crown Thinning</a></h5>\r\nThe process whereby the crown/foliated area of the tree is thinned out by removing 2nd 3rd 4th order branches within the crown structure in a uniform manner, usually calculated in percent(%) 10,15,20 or 25%. It is recognised that in general 20-25% is the maximum leaf area; one should remove, in any one growing season.When thinning the crown of a tree one has to be sensitive to the genus and species as each tree will react in different way according to how and when it is pruned.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/170-360x240.jpg\" alt=\"170\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Crown Reduction</a></h5>\r\nThe process where in effect the entire foliated area of the tree is reduced in size, creating a smaller crown. This will include reducing all branches from the outside inwards. This process is also calculated by percentage 10, 15, 20 or 25% and as in thinning no more than 25% should be done in one growing season. This type of work has been perfected by Canopy Tree staff over the years.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/deadwooding-360x240.png\" alt=\"deadwooding\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Deadwood</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown. When you notice large diameter branches above 20mm (50cm&gt;) which are a hazard and potential risk of damaging something below it might be time to call a tree professional.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Read more</a>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Why Choose Us?</h3>\r\n<h5>ï¿½<b>CONSULTATION &amp; SOLUTIONS</b></h5>\r\nAt Canopy Tree we believe there is a need for consultation regarding all things trees. It is recognised that in general 20-25% is the maximum leaf area; one should remove, in any one growing season.When thinning the crown of a tree one has to be sensitive to the genus and species as each tree will react in different way according to how and when it is pruned.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/170-360x240.jpg\" alt=\"170\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Crown Reduction</a></h5>\r\nThe process where in effect the entire foliated area of the tree is reduced in size, creating a smaller crown. This will include reducing all branches from the outside inwards. This process is also calculated by percentage 10, 15, 20 or 25% and as in thinning no more than 25% should be done in one growing season. This type of work has been perfected by Canopy Tree staff over the years.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/deadwooding-360x240.png\" alt=\"deadwooding\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Deadwood</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown. When you notice large diameter branches above 20mm (50cm&gt;) which are a hazard and potential risk of damaging something below it might be time to call a tree professional.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Read more</a>\r\n<h2 class=\"widget-title\">Testimonials</h2>\r\n<!-- Wrapper for slides --><cite class=\"testimonial__author\"> </cite> <i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i> <cite class=\"testimonial__author\"> </cite> <i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i>", guid = "http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/" WHERE ID = "689"

AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry.\r\n<h5></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Who We Are?</h3>\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">ï¿½</span><b>CANOPY TREE PTY LTD</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree PL has been servicing the greater Sydney and Macarthur areas for 16 years. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. This will include reducing all branches from the outside inwards. This process is also calculated by percentage 10, 15, 20 or 25% and as in thinning no more than 25% should be done in one growing season. This type of work has been perfected by Canopy Tree staff over the years.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/deadwooding-360x240.png\" alt=\"deadwooding\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Deadwood</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown. When you notice large diameter branches above 20mm (50cm&gt;) which are a hazard and potential risk of damaging something below it might be time to call a tree professional.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Read more</a>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Why Choose Us?</h3>\r\n<h5>ï¿½<b>CONSULTATION &amp; SOLUTIONS</b></h5>\r\nAt Canopy Tree we believe there is a need for consultation regarding all things trees. We are here to provide our wealth of experience and education to you in identifying helping and providing you with quick reliable and precise outcomes for your tree needs. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes as pest and disease or infrastructure damage identification and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5>\r\nReport &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome that is required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry.\r\n<h5></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Who We Are?</h3>\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">ï¿½</span><b>CANOPY TREE PTY LTD</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree PL has been servicing the greater Sydney and Macarthur areas for 16 years. The business is locally owned and operated, which enables us to offer high quality Tree work, tree care &amp; consultancy with practical and safe outcomes. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industry.ï¿½Insurance certificate: Public liability 20m, Workers Compensation and Professional indemnity 10m.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\r\n<h2 class=\"widget-title\">Testimonials</h2>\r\n<!-- Wrapper for slides -->\r\n<blockquote class=\"testimonial__quote\">We were delighted with the friendliness shown by you and the boys and the technical skills they displayed in cutting, mulching and removal of trees at our home. We have recommended Canopy Tree to many of our friends and they too have been very pleased with his work and professionalism.</blockquote>\r\n<cite class=\"testimonial__author\"> Samantha </cite> <i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i> <a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/branch-removal-pruning/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/7-360x240.png\" alt=\"7\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/branch-removal-pruning/\">Branch Removal &amp; Pruning</a></h5>\r\nThe process carried out by removing/pruning a select branch or branches within the crown of the tree, without interfering or damaging other tree parts in the process. This is a practice the staff at Canopy Tree can perform with the upmost care and skill utilising all the latest methods in advanced rigging at our disposal.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/branch-removal-pruning/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/shaping-pruning-trees/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/2-360x240.png\" alt=\"2\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/shaping-pruning-trees/\">Shaping &amp; Pruning of trees</a></h5>\r\nThe process carried out by utilising all the above methods on a small scale when pruning young newly planted trees, small ornamental trees, small street trees, trees under service lines or power lines. These are some of the many pruning tasks we are asked to carry out at Canopy Tree for our clients.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/shaping-pruning-trees/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/tree-palm-removal/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/452-685x1024-360x240.jpg\" alt=\"452-685x1024\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/tree-palm-removal/\">Tree &amp; Palm removal</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing a tree/palm from its standing form to ground level. At Canopy Tree we do remove trees if it is justified and the permission is granted from your local council. We are here to provide our wealth of experience and education to you in identifying helping and providing you with quick reliable and precise outcomes for your tree needs. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes as pest and disease or infrastructure damage identification and solutions. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5>\r\nReport &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome that is required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry.\r\n<h5></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Who We Are?</h3>\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">ï¿½</span><b>CANOPY TREE PTY LTD</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree PL has been servicing the greater Sydney and Macarthur areas for 16 years. The business is locally owned and operated, which enables us to offer high quality Tree work, tree care &amp; consultancy with practical and safe outcomes. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industry.ï¿½Insurance certificate: Public liability 20m, Workers Compensation and Professional indemnity 10m.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/9-360x240.png\" alt=\"9\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Crown Thinning</a></h5>\r\nThe process whereby the crown/foliated area of the tree is thinned out by removing 2nd 3rd 4th order branches within the crown structure in a uniform manner, usually calculated in percent(%) 10,15,20 or 25%. It is recognised that in general 20-25% is the maximum leaf area; one should remove, in any one growing season.When thinning the crown of a tree one has to be sensitive to the genus and species as each tree will react in different way according to how and when it is pruned.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/170-360x240.jpg\" alt=\"170\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Crown Reduction</a></h5>\r\nThe process where in effect the entire foliated area of the tree is reduced in size, creating a smaller crown. This will include reducing all branches from the outside inwards. This process is also calculated by percentage 10, 15, 20 or 25% and as in thinning no more than 25% should be done in one growing season. This type of work has been perfected by Canopy Tree staff over the years.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/deadwooding-360x240.png\" alt=\"deadwooding\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Deadwood</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown. When you notice large diameter branches above 20mm (50cm&gt;) which are a hazard and potential risk of damaging something below it might be time to call a tree professional.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Read more</a>\r\n<h2 class=\"widget-title\">Testimonials</h2>\r\n<!-- Wrapper for slides -->\r\n<blockquote class=\"testimonial__quote\">We were delighted with the friendliness shown by you and the boys and the technical skills they displayed in cutting, mulching and removal of trees at our home. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry.\r\n<h5></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Who We Are?</h3>\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">ï¿½</span><b>CANOPY TREE PTY LTD</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree PL has been servicing the greater Sydney and Macarthur areas for 16 years. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industry.ï¿½Insurance certificate: Public liability 20m, Workers Compensation and Professional indemnity 10m.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Our Services</h3>\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/9-360x240.png\" alt=\"9\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Crown Thinning</a></h5>\r\nThe process whereby the crown/foliated area of the tree is thinned out by removing 2nd 3rd 4th order branches within the crown structure in a uniform manner, usually calculated in percent(%) 10,15,20 or 25%. It is recognised that in general 20-25% is the maximum leaf area; one should remove, in any one growing season.When thinning the crown of a tree one has to be sensitive to the genus and species as each tree will react in different way according to how and when it is pruned.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/170-360x240.jpg\" alt=\"170\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Crown Reduction</a></h5>\r\nThe process where in effect the entire foliated area of the tree is reduced in size, creating a smaller crown. This will include reducing all branches from the outside inwards. This process is also calculated by percentage 10, 15, 20 or 25% and as in thinning no more than 25% should be done in one growing season. This type of work has been perfected by Canopy Tree staff over the years.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/deadwooding-360x240.png\" alt=\"deadwooding\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Deadwood</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown. When you notice large diameter branches above 20mm (50cm&gt;) which are a hazard and potential risk of damaging something below it might be time to call a tree professional.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n&nbsp;\r\n<h2 class=\"widget-title\">Testimonials</h2>\r\n<!-- Wrapper for slides -->\r\n<blockquote class=\"testimonial__quote\">We were delighted with the friendliness shown by you and the boys and the technical skills they displayed in cutting, mulching and removal of trees at our home. In every respect ï¿½ your assessment of the job, your written work description, the estimate of cost, the promptness of service, the attitude and technical skills displayed by the staff and the clean-up of our property. Your company cannot be faulted!</blockquote>\r\n<cite class=\"testimonial__author\"> Jeff </cite> <i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i><i class=\"fa  fa-star\"></i>\r\n<blockquote class=\"testimonial__quote\">Canopy Tree did a large amount of work at our property during 2008, trimming a large Tree in our back yard that hung heavily over the neighbours fence and our own roof. It may be a simple as tree identification or more complex outcomes as pest and disease or infrastructure damage identification and solutions. We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5>\r\nReport &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome that is required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry.\r\n<h5></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Who We Are?</h3>\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">ï¿½</span><b>CANOPY TREE PTY LTD</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree PL has been servicing the greater Sydney and Macarthur areas for 16 years. The business is locally owned and operated, which enables us to offer high quality Tree work, tree care &amp; consultancy with practical and safe outcomes. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industry.ï¿½Insurance certificate: Public liability 20m, Workers Compensation and Professional indemnity 10m.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Tree Services</h3>\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/9-360x240.png\" alt=\"9\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Crown Thinning</a></h5>\r\nThe process whereby the crown/foliated area of the tree is thinned out by removing 2nd 3rd 4th order branches within the crown structure in a uniform manner, usually calculated in percent(%) 10,15,20 or 25%. It is recognised that in general 20-25% is the maximum leaf area; one should remove, in any one growing season.When thinning the crown of a tree one has to be sensitive to the genus and species as each tree will react in different way according to how and when it is pruned.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-thinning/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/170-360x240.jpg\" alt=\"170\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Crown Reduction</a></h5>\r\nThe process where in effect the entire foliated area of the tree is reduced in size, creating a smaller crown. This will include reducing all branches from the outside inwards. This process is also calculated by percentage 10, 15, 20 or 25% and as in thinning no more than 25% should be done in one growing season. This type of work has been perfected by Canopy Tree staff over the years.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/crown-reduction/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/deadwooding-360x240.png\" alt=\"deadwooding\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Deadwood</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing dead and dying branches from the tree whether in the crown or on the main stem of the tree. Generally as an owner if you look at your tree closely from time to time you may notice dead looking branches throughout the tree crown. When you notice large diameter branches above 20mm (50cm&gt;) which are a hazard and potential risk of damaging something below it might be time to call a tree professional.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/deadwood/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n&nbsp;\r\n<h2 class=\"widget-title\">Testimonials</h2>\r\n<!-- Wrapper for slides -->\r\n<blockquote class=\"testimonial__quote\">We were delighted with the friendliness shown by you and the boys and the technical skills they displayed in cutting, mulching and removal of trees at our home. Whatever it may be give us a call today with your enquiry? We will provide an estimate of costs and arrange a site visit on your approval!\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>REPORTS &amp; MANAGEMENT PLANS</b></h5>\r\nReport &amp; management plans come in many different forms, dependant on the outcome that is required. AQF level 5 Arborist or consulting Arborist as they are known, is qualified to write reports for councils, commercial or private clients. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports. Report writing is a specialised profession carried out by trained professionals meeting the above requirements and experience in the tree industry.\r\n<h5></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Who We Are?</h3>\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #16d116;\">ï¿½</span><b>CANOPY TREE PTY LTD</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree PL has been servicing the greater Sydney and Macarthur areas for 16 years. The business is locally owned and operated, which enables us to offer high quality Tree work, tree care &amp; consultancy with practical and safe outcomes. The owner is a member of Arboriculture Australia and the International Society of Arboriculture keeping up to date with industry news and standards. Nicholas is still an active tree climber in the business with an education, wide experience of trees and over twenty years in the industry.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span><b>OUR AIM</b></h5>\r\nCanopy Tree Pty Ltd aims to provide superior standards of tree maintenance, conservation, service and education through dedication, commitment and purpose in all aspects of the amenity tree industry. All work is conducted to the Australian Standard Pruning of Amenity Trees AS4373-2007 and to the current code of practice put out by Work Cover for the Amenity Tree Industry.ï¿½Insurance certificate: Public liability 20m, Workers Compensation and Professional indemnity 10m.\r\n<h5><span style=\"color: #fcc71f;\">ï¿½</span></h5>\r\n<h3 class=\"widget-title\">Tree Services</h3>\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/tree-pruning/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/2-360x240.png\" alt=\"2\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/tree-pruning/\">Tree Pruning</a></h5>\r\nThe process carried out by utilising all the above methods on a small scale when pruning young newly planted trees, small ornamental trees, small street trees, trees under service lines or power lines. These are some of the many pruning tasks we are asked to carry out at Canopy Tree for our clients.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/tree-pruning/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/tree-removal/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/452-685x1024-360x240.jpg\" alt=\"452-685x1024\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/tree-removal/\">Tree Removal</a></h5>\r\nThe process of removing a tree/palm from its standing form to ground level. At Canopy Tree we do remove trees if it is justified and the permission is granted from your local council. Having over two decades of experience between us we can say that all trees are a challenge and no one tree is the same but you can be confident we will be safe though full caring and only leave you a memory when it is gone.\r\n\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/our-services/tree-removal/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n<a class=\"page-box__picture\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wood-chip-and-leaf-mulch-suppliers/\"><img class=\"attachment-page-box wp-post-image\" src=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/12-360x240.png\" alt=\"12\" width=\"360\" height=\"240\" /></a>\r\n<h5 class=\"page-box__title  text-uppercase\"><a href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wood-chip-and-leaf-mulch-suppliers/\">Wood Chip and Leaf Mulch Suppliers</a></h5>\r\n<a class=\"read-more  read-more--page-box\" href=\"http://localhost:8888/ROC-Client-System-Generator/website/wood-chip-and-leaf-mulch-suppliers/\">Read more</a>\r\n\r\n&nbsp;\r\n<h2 class=\"widget-title\">Testimonials</h2>\r\n<!-- Wrapper for slides -->\r\n<blockquote class=\"testimonial__quote\">We were delighted with the friendliness shown by you and the boys and the technical skills they displayed in cutting, mulching and removal of trees at our home. An AQF level 3 Arborist (Practising Arborist) is not qualified to write reports under Australian standards for education in the tree industry. You will also find that persons with University qualifications such as Hort science degree or a degree in Arboriculture may write reports.
